page.title: 11A FARMHOUSE IN STREATLEY
page.content: {Thurle Grange}has been a farm since 1544 and was owned by a family called Allen until 1890. The present building is{Edwardian}and was built in 1910 and is divided into different {apartments.}Mr. McCulloch, who farms in this area, lives in one third of the house, while his son lives in another third. The rest of the house is rented out as flats to the public. At the entrance there are 2 tall gate-posts,made of flints and bricks. The{flints}are local building material collected from the top of the Downs. In the garden, by the entrance there is an old well which is now covered up.
